entry.title: Are DAOs Dead? Judge Ruling in bZx Case Spells Trouble, Legal Experts Say
entry.summary: A federal judge has ruled that individual members of bZx DAO could be found liable in lawsuits against the entity. Here's what that means for token holders.

entry.title: Ex-Binance US CEO Catherine Coley Hires Attorney for CFTC Lawsuit: Report
entry.summary: Coley, who abruptly left Binance US in April 2021, has reportedly hired Sullivan & Cromwell partner James McDonald.

entry.title: Magic Eden’s New Bitcoin NFT Marketplace Dominates Ordinals Market
entry.summary: After just over a week, Magic Eden now accounts for more than half of Ordinals inscription trading volume across marketplaces.

entry.title: Why Pirate Nation Is Leaving Polygon and Setting Sail Towards Arbitrum Nova
entry.summary: Developer Proof of Play plans to deploy its on-chain game on Arbitrum Nova after soaking up players' rising Polygon gas fees.

entry.title: Judge Again Orders 3AC Co-Founder to Surrender Financial Documents
entry.summary: If Kyle Davies fails to comply, the 3AC liquidators could seek “to hold Davies in contempt.”

entry.title: Midjourney Kills Free AI Image Generator Access After Explosion of Deep Fakes
entry.summary: Say goodbye to popes in puffer coats: The popular text-to-image platform is hitting pause to combat deep fakes.

entry.title: CFTC, SEC, DOJ, IRS: These Are the Ongoing Investigations Into Binance
entry.summary: The world’s biggest cryptocurrency exchange was sued this week by the CFTC. But a number of cases remain open.

entry.title: Citi Says Mass Adoption of Crypto Will Be Driven by CBDCs, Tokenization
entry.summary: Crypto is approaching a "point of inflection," say analysts at Citi, pointing to the rise of tokenization and CBDCs around the world.

entry.title: Matt Damon Says He Did Crypto.Com Ad Due to 'Down Year' at Clean Water Foundation
entry.summary: The Hollywood star said he partnered with Crypto.com in 2021 to get financial backing for his water.org initiative.

entry.title: Sky Mavis Signs Deals With Directive Games, Bali Games, Tribes, and Bowled to Build Web3 Games
entry.summary: The Sky Mavis team told Decrypt how it is curating Ronin’s ecosystem with titles across genres and platforms.

entry.title: Blocktrace Builds AI Chatbot to Simplify Blockchain Transaction Tracking
entry.summary: The startup is starting with Bitcoin, supporting natural language queries to scan transactions.

entry.title: Candy Digital Pushes Forward With New MLB NFTs After Fanatics Divestment
entry.summary: Candy CEO Scott Lawin discusses its third season of Major League Baseball collectibles, plus its recent investor shakeup and layoffs.

entry.title: Virtual Couture? Vivienne Tam’s First NFT Dress Struts Around Metaverse Fashion Week
entry.summary: The dress, inspired by Bored Ape Yacht Club NFTs and Tam’s signature East-meets-West design aesthetic, debuted in Decentraland this week.

entry.title: Pussy Riot Protest Art NFT Triggers Russian Criminal Charges
entry.summary: Activist artist Nadya Tolokonnikova was added to a wanted list over a 2021 NFT piece depicting the Virgin Mary.

entry.title: Coin Center Says RESTRICT Act Could Be Used to Ban Bitcoin
entry.summary: Though it primarily targets companies like Tik-Tok, the bill’s language is much too broad, according to the crypto advocacy group.

entry.title: At Least $37M Worth of y00ts NFTs Migrate to Polygon From Solana in One Day
entry.summary: Nearly 77% of all y00ts NFTs have switched chains since late Monday, with DeGods still set to leave Solana for Ethereum this Friday.

entry.title: SEC's Gensler Insists Clear Rules for Crypto Market 'Already Exist'
entry.summary: But the regulator says that the digital asset industry is still “rife with noncompliance.”

entry.title: Paxful Vows to Refund Celsius Earn Bankruptcy Victims
entry.summary: “We all need to hold ourselves to a higher standard,” declared CEO Ray Youssef.

entry.title: Art Blocks Debuts NFT Marketplace With Enforced Creator Royalties
entry.summary: The generative art NFT platform now has a secondary marketplace—and is considering how to incentivize royalties-paying collectors.

entry.title: Warner Music Plans to Spare Web3, AI Roles Amid Layoffs
entry.summary: The music label’s CEO cited “new tech initiatives” as central to the company’s future.

entry.title: Degens 'Ran Away With the Narrative' on Gitcoin’s NFT Drop With Vitalik, Says Founder Kevin Owocki
entry.summary: Despite only playing a marginal role in Metalabel's NFT collection with Gitcoin, the Ethereum founder's name led to runaway speculation.

entry.title: Elon Musk, Steve Wozniak Urge OpenAI to Halt ChatGPT Upgrades
entry.summary: An online petition with over 1,100 public signatures calls for a six-month moratorium on further enhancements to the leading AI tool.

entry.title: Kevin Smith, Web3 Film Fund Decentralized Pictures Award $40,000 to Comedy Filmmakers
entry.summary: Stoner comedy “Holy Smokes” scoops the top award from Roman Coppola’s decentralized film financing platform.

entry.title: Bitcoin Shakes Off Regulatory Crackdown, Jumps Nearly 6% in 24 Hours
entry.summary: The price of the biggest cryptocurrency by market cap is up by a significant margin—despite financial uncertainty and regulatory woes this week.

entry.title: US, South Korea Seek Terra Co-Founder Do Kwon’s Extradition
entry.summary: The Terra co-founder Do Kwon and his associate Han Chang Joon will first face charges in Montenegro for allegedly using forged documents.

entry.title: Meme Coin Project SafeMoon Rekt for $9M Due to Public Burn Bug
entry.summary: A recent upgrade to meme coin SafeMoon’s smart contract saw the project robbed of $8.9 million—and then stolen again.

entry.title: New Texas Senate Bill Seeks to Slash Bitcoin Mining Incentives
entry.summary: A new bill seeks to introduce restrictions on Bitcoin mining activities in Texas, while also reducing incentives for the industry.

entry.title: Ethereum Staking Tokens Jump Double Digits as Shanghai Upgrade Gets a Date
entry.summary: Tokens powering popular liquid staking protocols for Ethereum, like Lido Finance and Rocket Pool, enjoyed a heady run on Wednesday.

entry.title: What the Binance CFTC Lawsuit Means for Crypto
entry.summary: The charges against Binance are stiff, and the penalties could be business-ending. Here’s what you need to know.

entry.title: Siri, You’re Fired!
entry.summary: An AI developer wrote a simple script to replace the iconic Apple assistant with ChatGPT. The internet rejoiced.

entry.title: Jack Dorsey-Backed Spiral Plots Course for Mainstream Adoption of Bitcoin’s Lightning Network
entry.summary: LDK, the Lightning Network implementation being developed by the Jack Dorsey-backed Spiral, has got big plans to improve the way payments can be made on Bitcoin.

entry.title: F1 Team Adds Crypto Sponsor in Kraken After FTX, Tezos Exits
entry.summary: Formula 1’s crypto presence shrank in recent months, but the pool is growing again as Kraken teams up with Williams Racing.

entry.title: North Korean Hackers Use Cloud Mining Services to Launder Dirty Crypto
entry.summary: Cloud-based infrastructure can save costs—but may also be an attractive avenue for criminals.

entry.title: Microsoft Unveils Security Copilot, a Cybersecurity Tool That Uses Generative AI
entry.summary: The software giant aims to use artificial intelligence to beef up its security measures, including instant threat detection.

entry.title: CFTC Lawsuit Won't Affect Binance's Acquisition of Voyager, Experts Say
entry.summary: The Justice Department is currently appealing a judge’s approval of a deal that allows Binance’s U.S. affiliate to acquire Voyager’s distressed assets.

entry.title: gm: Coinbase's Top Lawyer Gets Real on SEC
entry.summary: Paul Grewal is the Chief Legal Officer at Coinbase and a former U.S. magistrate judge in Northern California. He gave Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott his candid takes on Sam Bankman-Fried and FTX, the SEC's crackdown on staking, the sanctioning of Tornado Cash, and more alpha on how Coinbase is approaching the current unfriendly US regulatory environment. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Sam Bankman-Fried Charged With Bribing Chinese Government Officials
entry.summary: The FTX founder now faces a total of 13 criminal charges in connection with the collapse of the crypto exchange.

entry.title: BNB Slips Over 5% Following Binance CFTC Lawsuit
entry.summary: Binance CEO CZ responded to the CFTC’s lawsuit, stating that its complaint "appears to contain an incomplete recitation of facts."

entry.title: Tested on Ethereum, StarkWare’s Zero-Knowledge Proofs Are Now Live on Bitcoin
entry.summary: Zero-knowledge proofs developed by Ethereum scaling firm StarkWare are now making a debut on the Bitcoin blockchain.

entry.title: Disney Cuts Metaverse Unit Amid Company-Wide Layoffs: Report
entry.summary: Recent Disney layoffs have seen its metaverse unit of 50 completely cut from the company while the head of the team remains.

entry.title: It’s Been a Month—Who’s Building on Chiliz Chain 2.0?
entry.summary: A month after launching Chiliz Chain 2.0, the project’s CEO is eager to get more developers and projects to start building on it.

entry.title: The Founder of Rotten Tomatoes Says Web3 Entertainment Isn’t Nearly Entertaining Enough Yet
entry.summary: Rotten Tomatoes founder Patrick Lee, who has led companies at the intersection of technology and entertainment from Web1 to Web3, spoke to Decrypt's Sander Lutz at Outer Edge LA about the current state of decentralized gaming, film and television.

entry.title: gm: How Gnosis Has Endured and Evolved
entry.summary: Gnosis first launched in 2015 as a decentralized prediction market built on Ethereum. Now it's a DAO, a multi-sig wallet, a staking chain, and a vibrant community with its own GNO governance token. Co-founder and COO Friederike Ernst talked to Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott about the careful evolution of Gnosis, decentralization impostors, account abstraction, DeFi UX failures, why Ethereum is the "Manhattan of crypto," and much more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Justin Aversano's Inspiration for Tarot-Themed NFT Photo Series 'Smoke and Mirrors'
entry.summary: Justin Aversano, best known for his high-selling "Twin Flames" NFT photo series, joined Decrypt’s Andrew Hayward ahead of the upcoming L.A. exhibition for his new Ethereum NFT project "Smoke and Mirrors." He shared the wild inspiration behind the tarot-themed collection, and why—despite his growing profile—he opted not to exhibit at a major brand-name gallery.

entry.title: Midnight Society’s Rob Bowling Talks Deadrop Launch and Working With Dr. Disrespect
entry.summary: Former "Call of Duty" developer Rob Bowling, now head of Midnight Society Studio, checked in with Decrypt's Kate Irwin at GDC and shared some behind-the-scenes statistics on how players are enjoying "Deadrop." The game saw 90,000 player hours over the weekend, with 97 minutes average play time per player, and their community size tripled in just a few days.

entry.title: Big Brands Get Serious About NFTs: Salesforce, VW, Panerai, Absolute Labs at NFT Paris
entry.summary: On this panel from NFT Paris 2023 moderated by Decrypt's Dan Roberts, Web3 leads from some of the largest consumer and tech brands discuss their NFT strategies. Marc Mathieu of Salesforce, Tim Walther of VW Group, Eva Assayag of Panerai, and Samir Addamine of Absolute Labs joined the panel.

entry.title: NFT Entertainment Revolution: Warner Bros, Orange Comet, CyberBrokers and NFT Now at NFT Paris
entry.summary: At NFT Paris 2023, Decrypt’s Stephen Graves moderated a discussion about NFTs and the entertainment industry with Warner Bros’ NFT head Josh Hackbarth, CyberBrokers founder Josie Bellini, NFT Now founder Matt Medved and Dave Broome, CEO of Orange Comet, which has produced NFTs for Anthony Hopkins and The Walking Dead.

entry.title: Step Inside the Armory of the NFT Collective 'Knights Who Say Nah'
entry.summary: Knights Who Say Nah co-founder and project lead Nick Richey chats with Decrypt's Jason Nelson inside the group's armory of artifacts, shows off a historic Japanese tanto sword, and discusses why the preservation of historical artifacts is the best use case for NFTs.

entry.title: Voltz Labs CEO: DeFi Innovation Is Moving Offshore Because of US Regulatory Severity
entry.summary: Voltz Labs Co-founder and CEO Simon Jones talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about using DeFi for interest rate swaps, the unfriendly regulatory environment in the US right now, emerging economies becoming crypto hubs, and the "cartoonishly large" market opportunity for DeFi.

entry.title: MoonPay CEO: Next Phase of NFT Adoption Will Come From 'Brands You Love in Your Everyday Life'
entry.summary: MoonPay CEO Ivan Soto-Wright talked to Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris about how NFTs are clearly not "waning," how MoonPay works with brands like Puma and Nike to manage their Web3 plays and smart contracts, and how NFTs and crypto will go mainstream when they can integrate in our daily lives—and his prediction that brands will drive that.

entry.title: Framework Ventures Is 'Optimistic That Regulators Are Much More Educated' About Crypto Than in Past
entry.summary: Brandon Potts, a principal at Web3 VC firm Framework Ventures, spoke to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about his investment focus, his outlook on crypto regulation right now, and why he's optimistic for the industry even amid the bear market and recent regulatory actions.

entry.title: Why LAL Art Has 'No Interest In Just Putting the Traditional Art Market on the Blockchain'
entry.summary: Fanny Lakoubay, the founder of art advisory and agency LAL Art, talked to Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris about what LAL Art does, how it works with artists, museums, directors, and galleries, and why artists in Web3 have to "reinvent themselves every six months."

entry.title: Collab.Land Grew 'Because of Covid' Creating Need for DAO Tools: Co-founder Anjali Young
entry.summary: Anjali Young, the co-founder of Abridged and Collab.Land, talked to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about the origins of Collab.Land and says it erupted thanks to Covid, which created not just new interest in crypto but the need for better tools for DAO member collaboration.

entry.title: Artist Mat Collishaw is Exploring the 'Mutability' of NFTs
entry.summary: Visual artist Mat Collishaw, who uses mixed media to explore beauty, is about to launch Heterosis, a metaverse art experience with dynamic NFTs hosted by OG.Art. He spoke to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about how he came to Web3.

entry.title: Absolute Labs CEO: Big Brands Are Trying to Understand and Harness Crypto Wallets
entry.summary: Samir Addamine, Co-founder and CEO of Web3 CRM software company Absolute Labs, told Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris that big consumer brands are rushing to figure out crypto wallets and how they can harness them for their marketing purposes and to deepen ties with customers.

entry.title: NFT Collector Gmoney: 'Marketplaces Have Nothing to Trade Without Creators'
entry.summary: Pseudonymous NFT collector Gmoney talks to Decrypt's Dan Roberts at NFT Paris about his Web3 luxury brand 9dcc, big brands getting into NFTs, the debate over creator royalty fees, and what will come next to the space.

entry.title: Head of Product for IEX's Dispatch: 'We See Tokens as the Social Graph of Web3'
entry.summary: Dispatch is a new Web3 marketing, messaging, and ad tech tool from IEX Group, which also owns the IEX exchange fighting high-frequency trading and made famous in the book "Flash Boys" by Michael Lewis. Dispatch head of product Sean Spector sat down with Decrypt's Liam Kelly at NFT Paris to talk about Dispatch's product vision and why Web2 companies are jumping into Web3.

entry.title: Community Gaming CEO: Ethereum Smart Contracts Can Solve 'Pain Points' of Gamers Getting Paid
entry.summary: Chris Gonsalves, CEO of esports tournament platform Community Gaming, talks to Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about Web3 gaming, his past stint at ConsenSys, and using smart contracts to get gamers paid instantly. Community Gaming has also just announced the 3XP Gaming Expo, June 8-9 in Pasadena, CA.

entry.title: gm: Neal Stephenson Maps Out the Metaverse
entry.summary: Neal Stephenson coined the term “metaverse” in his seminal 1992 sci-fi hit novel “Snow Crash.” Now he’s helming a metaverse blockchain company called Lamina1 and advocating for one free and open metaverse. He spoke to Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves at length about what he got right and wrong in “Snow Crash,” goggles and flat screens, Big Tech, NFTs and digital ownership, and more. Watch and make sure to subscribe to the gm podcast on Apple or Spotify.

entry.title: Fireblocks Is Laser-Focused on the Picks and Shovels: Web3 Products Lead at ETH Denver
entry.summary: Omer Amsel, head of Web3 products at crypto custody and settlement provider Fireblocks, told Decrypt's Jason Nelson at ETH Denver about why crypto market cycles are best for building, how Fireblocks is focused on providing "picks and shovels," and why the company still believes in the long-term promise of Web3.
